title: HS2 chief says line will be showcase for green values - in 100 years
text:
It is billed as one of the most "environmentally responsible" infrastructure projects the UK has ever seen. But the green credentials of HS2 will take a hundred years to be fully realised, the scheme's chief executive has admitted.

Mark Thurston, who runs HS2 Ltd, the government-owned firm building the line, said the "net benefit" to the environment would not "play out" for some time after the railway's planned opening. Ministers have suggested that it may not fully open until 2040.

The lag is down to the fact that the line, which is due to run from London to Birmingham and then onto Leeds and Manchester, requires a "huge amount of concrete" to build, Mr Thurston said.
